messages.author: akalin
messages.text:
These need to be strings.  You weren't on the earlier thread when we discussed it, but here's what I said:

I talked about this briefly with Ben when I was in MTV last week.
Basically, the "sync-team recommended" way to sync app order would be
to add a string field to the app specifics proto representing the
order, as well as some special logic to make sure that only O(1) app
sync datas are modified whenever an app is moved, deleted, etc.

Aside from the code change itself, there may be bugs arising from a few sources:
- Older clients should preserve this order field, even though it may
not recognize/respect it.
- Newer clients would need to deal with data from older clients not
having this field.
- Some extensions/apps are not synced, so their ordering would have to
figured out.

....

There's no need to involve floating point in this.  Just use
lexicographic ordering of strings, appending a new digit to the string
when necessary, and you're good.  The disadvantage is unbounded growth
over time, but that seems like a pathological case, and can be
mitigated by 'resetting' the strings.

messages.author: akalin
messages.text: Please provide detailed comments about what exactly the app launch index represents.

messages.author: akalin
messages.text: Also, please provide detailed comments about what the page index is.  I haven't been able to determine whether or not this should be a string, as I don't know what it represents.
